data.text:
Korean Air Celebrates 30 Years in the UK!

September 1988 saw a Korean Air’s Boeing 747E aircraft from Seoul via Anchorage touchdown at London’s Gatwick Airport heralding the commencement of the service. Now, London-Seoul route is one of the main routes for Korean Air. https://t.co/a79i3zo9Hs

Today is the National Foundation Day (개천절) of Korea, celebrates the legendary formation of the first Korean state of Gojoseon in 2333 BC.

#KoreanAir #Korea #NationalFoundationDay https://t.co/ZKfObGT6za

data.text:
Korean Air has been relocated to Incheon Airport's Terminal 2 from January 2018 onwards. Are you curious about how to travel between Terminal 1 and 2?

1. Free shuttle bus:
Pick up point: Exit 8, 3/F, Terminal 1 or Exit 4-5, 3/F, Terminal 2
2. Airport Railway: ₩900

#KoreanAir https://t.co/SGxeok6btD

Forgot your personal belongings in cabin? Our Quick Search Tool on Korean Air’s official website helps you to check for items left behind in the cabin. Simply enter the Region, Airport, Lost item Category and Date, a list of lost items will be shown to help you finding yours. https://t.co/tJCn5FRLLe

Many people gather in Yeongdodaegyo Bridge around 2:00pm every day because the bridge will be raised once a day to allow ships to pass between the south and north ports.

data.text:
Good news! 
Starting from September 1, 2018, Korean Air will commence a direct scheduled service between Seoul, South Korea and Zagreb, the capital of Croatia three times a week (Tuesday/Thursday/Saturday)! 

#KoreanAir #Korea #Croatia #Zagreb https://t.co/APFrZ4SfRQ
